docs.snippet: The Swedish authorities arrested three men on suspicion of rape and urged people with access to images showing the episode to make them available to the police.

headline.print_headline: Swedish Police Investigate Report of Rape on Facebook Live
headline.main: Swedish Police Investigate Report of Rape on Facebook Live

docs.snippet: The social network said it would provide marketers with measurement data down to the millisecond and agree to let a third party audit the information.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Takes Steps to Improve Advertising Data After Criticism
headline.main: Facebook Takes Steps to Improve Advertising Data After Criticism

docs.snippet: Gunmen opened fire while one journalist was reading the news at a station east of Santo Domingo. His producer was killed in another room.

headline.print_headline: Dominicans Arrest Three in Killings Streamed Live
headline.main: Facebook Live Killing of Dominican Journalists Leads to Arrest of 3 Men

docs.snippet: Google and Facebook’s recent efforts show a new vigilance against fake news but also underline the difficulty of making dents in the problem.

headline.main: Daily Report: Google and Facebook Wield Buckets in Fake News Flood

docs.snippet: Google and Facebook emphasized their efforts to combat the spread of false articles, but industry watchers say their measures have had little impact.

headline.print_headline: In Race vs. Fake News, Google and Facebook Stroll to the Starting Line
headline.main: In Race Against Fake News, Google and Facebook Stroll to the Starting Line

docs.snippet: George J. McShane Jr., who posted messages to dupe his wife’s relatives about her absence, was charged with murder, according to the Orlando police.

headline.main: Florida Man Strangled Wife, Then Impersonated Her on Facebook, Police Say

docs.snippet: The effort calls for, among other things, the company to forge deeper ties with news organizations by collaborating on publishing tools and features before they are released.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Project to Forge Deeper Ties to Media
headline.main: Facebook, Nodding to Its Role in Media, Starts a Journalism Project

docs.snippet: The former NBC News correspondent and CNN prime-time host comes to Facebook as it struggles with its position as a content provider that does not produce its own content.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Hires Former NBC Correspondent to Lead News Partnerships Team
headline.main: Facebook Hires Campbell Brown to Lead News Partnerships Team

docs.snippet: A review of important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: Mike’s and Sapna’s Week in Tech: There are Zombie Social Networks. Then There’s Facebook.

docs.snippet: Sales for the social media giant grew 51 percent in the most recent quarter, and a $500 million jury decision should do little to hurt its bottom line.

headline.print_headline: For Facebook, Loss in Court Can’t Dim a Huge Quarter
headline.main: Facebook’s Loss in Court Doesn’t Dim Excitement Over Huge Growth
